displaytitle: Life photographer Margaret Bourke-White prepares to photograph an air battle on the Italian front during World War II
creditline: Museum purchase, Fowler McCormick, Class of 1921, Fund
markings:
Stamp in red ink, center left: LIFE PICTURE COLLECTION 

Stamp in blue ink, center: LIFE PHOTO BY | MARGARET BOURKE-WHITE

Stamp in red ink, center left: RETURN TO | TIME INC. | FILE 

Stamp in blue ink, lower center [in oval]: NO OBJECTION TO PUBLICATION | Security Sec. | Bur Pub. Relations | JUN 5 1945 | 2 | WAR DEPARTMENT
inscribed:
Handwritten in graphite on verso, upper left: Artillery 

Handwritten in graphite on verso, upper center: Italy near Casino | attack on | [illegible]

Inscribed in blue ink on verso, center right: Life Set #14264

Inscribed in black ink on verso, center: Bourke-White, Margaret | photographing air | cavalry on Italian front 

Handwritten in graphite on verso, lower center: Return to Time Inc. Archives 

Handwritten in graphite on verso, lower left: HG | Schwartz 

Inscribed in graphite on verso, lower center: MB434 

Inscribed in graphtie on verso, lower right: PF129686-111

caption: Margaret Bourke-White (1904–1971; born Bronx, NY; died Stamford, CT), for LIFE magazine, Life photographer Margaret Bourke-White prepares to photograph an air battle on the Italian front during World War II, 1943. Gelatin silver print; 24.1 × 17.5 cm. Museum purchase, Fowler McCormick, Class of 1921, Fund (2018-37)
